plugin-api/MediaBrowser.Tests.Consistenc.title: Class StringUsageReporter | Documentation - Jellyfin Project
plugin-api/MediaBrowser.Tests.Consistenc.keywords: Class StringUsageReporter This class contains tests for reporting the usage of localization string tokens in the dashboard-ui or similar. Inheritance System.Object StringUsageReporter Inherited Members System.Object.ToString() System.Object.Equals(System.Object) System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.GetHashCode() System.Object.GetType() System.Object.MemberwiseClone() Namespace : MediaBrowser.Tests.ConsistencyTests Assembly : MediaBrowser.Tests.dll Syntax [TestClass] public class StringUsageReporter Remarks Run one of the two tests using Visual Studio's "Test Explorer": On successful run, the bottom section of the test explorer will contain a link "Output". This link will open the test results, displaying the trace and two attachment links. One link will open the output folder, the other link will open the output xml file. The output xml file contains a stylesheet link to render the results as html. How that works depends on the default application configured for XML files: Visual StudioWill open in XML source view. To view the html result, click menu 'XML' => 'Start XSLT without debugging' Internet ExplorerXSL transform will be applied automatically. FirefoxXSL transform will be applied automatically. ChromeDoes not work. Chrome is unable/unwilling to apply xslt transforms from local files. Fields | Improve this Doc View Source ExcludePaths List of paths to exclude from search. Declaration public static string[] ExcludePaths Field Value Type Description System.String [] | Improve this Doc View Source OutputPath Path to the output folder Declaration public const string OutputPath = "." Field Value Type Description System.String Remarks Can be an absolute path or a path relative to the binaries folder (bin\Debug). Important: When changing the output path, make sure that "StringCheck.xslt" is present to make the XML transform work. | Improve this Doc View Source StringsFile Path to the strings file, relative to WebFolder . plugin-api/Emby.Server.Implementations.D.title: Enum TempStoreMode | Documentation - Jellyfin Project
plugin-api/Emby.Server.Implementations.D.keywords: Enum TempStoreMode Storage mode used by temporary database files. Namespace : Emby.Server.Implementations.Data Assembly : Emby.Server.Implementations.dll Syntax public enum TempStoreMode : int Fields Name Description Default The compile-time C preprocessor macro SQLITE_TEMP_STORE is used to determine where temporary tables and indices are stored. File Temporary tables and indices are stored in a file. Memory Temporary tables and indices are kept in as if they were pure in-memory databases memory.

plugin-api/Emby.Server.Implementations.D.title: Enum SynchronousMode | Documentation - Jellyfin Project
plugin-api/Emby.Server.Implementations.D.keywords: Enum SynchronousMode The disk synchronization mode, controls how aggressively SQLite will write data all the way out to physical storage. Namespace : Emby.Server.Implementations.Data Assembly : Emby.Server.Implementations.dll Syntax public enum SynchronousMode : int Fields Name Description Extra EXTRA synchronous is like FULL with the addition that the directory containing a rollback journal is synced after that journal is unlinked to commit a transaction in DELETE mode. Full SQLite database engine will use the xSync method of the VFS to ensure that all content is safely written to the disk surface prior to continuing. Normal SQLite database engine will still sync at the most critical moments Off SQLite continues without syncing as soon as it has handed data off to the operating system

System.String verbs A comma-delimited list of HTTP verbs supported by the service. If unspecified, all verbs are assumed to be supported. Properties | Improve this Doc View Source Description Declaration public string Description { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.String | Improve this Doc View Source IsHidden Declaration public bool IsHidden { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Boolean | Improve this Doc View Source Notes Gets or sets longer text to explain the behaviour of the route. Declaration public string Notes { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.String | Improve this Doc View Source Path Gets or sets the path template to be mapped to the request. Declaration public string Path { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.String A value providing the path mapped to the request. Never null . Remarks Some examples of valid paths are: Variables are specified within "{}" brackets. Each variable in the path is mapped to the same-named property on the request DTO. At runtime, ServiceStack will parse the request URL, extract the variable values, instantiate the request DTO, and assign the variable values into the corresponding request properties, prior to passing the request DTO to the service object for processing. It is not necessary to specify all request properties as variables in the path. For unspecified properties, callers may provide values in the query string. For example: the URL " http://services/Inventory?Category=Books&ItemId=12345&quot ; causes the same request DTO to be processed as " http://services/Inventory/Books/12345&quot ;, provided that the paths "/Inventory" (which supports the first URL) and "/Inventory/{Category}/{ItemId}" (which supports the second URL) are both mapped to the request DTO. Please note that while it is possible to specify property values in the query string, it is generally considered to be less RESTful and less desirable than to specify them as variables in the path. Using the query string to specify property values may also interfere with HTTP caching. The final variable in the path may contain a " " suffix to grab all remaining segments in the path portion of the request URL and assign them to a single property on the request DTO. For example, if the path "/Inventory/{ItemPath }" is mapped to the request DTO, then the request URL " http://services/Inventory/Books/12345&quot ; will result in a request DTO whose ItemPath property contains "Books/12345". You may only specify one such variable in the path, and it must be positioned at the end of the path. | Improve this Doc View Source Priority Used to rank the precedences of route definitions in reverse routing. i.e. Priorities below 0 are auto-generated have less precedence. Declaration public int Priority { get; set; } Property Value Type Description System.Int32 | Improve this Doc View Source Summary Gets or sets short summary of what the route does.
